TITLE: Manual Transaction Management
DESCRIPTION: Example of manually managing transactions using transBegin(), transCommit(), and transRollback() methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/database/transactions.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
if ($this->db->transBegin()) {
    $this->db->query('AN SQL QUERY...');
    $this->db->query('ANOTHER QUERY...');

    if ($this->db->transStatus() === false) {
        $this->db->transRollback();
    } else {
        $this->db->transCommit();
    }
}
```

TITLE: Testing CLI Commands with MockInputOutput in CodeIgniter 4
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to test a CLI command ('db:table') that requires user input using the MockInputOutput class. The test sets up mock inputs, executes the command, and then verifies the output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/testing/cli.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace CodeIgniter\Commands\Database;

use CodeIgniter\CLI\CLI;
use CodeIgniter\CLI\MockInputOutput;
use CodeIgniter\Test\CIUnitTestCase;
use CodeIgniter\Test\Filters\CITestStreamFilter;

final class TableCommandTest extends CIUnitTestCase
{
    private $io;

    protected function setUp(): void
    {
        parent::setUp();

        $this->io = new MockInputOutput();
        CLI::setInputOutput($this->io);
    }

    protected function tearDown(): void
    {
        CLI::resetInputOutput();

        parent::tearDown();
    }

    public function testTableList(): void
    {
        // Set the input 'posts'
        $this->io->setInputs(['posts']);

        command('db:table');

        // Get command output
        $output = $this->io->getOutput();

        // Check output text
        $this->assertStringContainsString('Table information for table:', $output);
        $this->assertStringContainsString('posts', $output);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Routes in CodeIgniter 4.x
DESCRIPTION: Example of route configuration in CodeIgniter 4.x, showing the new object-oriented approach to defining routes with the Routes service instead of an array. It demonstrates how to set default routes and add specific route mappings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_routing.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace Config;

// Create a new instance of our RouteCollection class.
$routes = Services::routes();

// Load the system's routing file first, so that the app and ENVIRONMENT
// can override as needed.
if (is_file(SYSTEMPATH . 'Config/Routes.php')) {
    require SYSTEMPATH . 'Config/Routes.php';
}

/*
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Router Setup
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
$routes->setDefaultNamespace('App\Controllers');
$routes->setDefaultController('Home');
$routes->setDefaultMethod('index');
$routes->setTranslateURIDashes(false);
$routes->set404Override();
// The Auto Routing (Legacy) is very dangerous. It is easy to create vulnerable apps
// where controller filters or CSRF protection are bypassed.
// If you don't want to define all routes, please use the Auto Routing (Improved).
// Set `$autoRoutesImproved` to true in `app/Config/Feature.php` and set the following to true.
// $routes->setAutoRoute(false);

/*
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Route Definitions
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 */

// We get a performance increase by specifying the default
// route since we don't have to scan directories.
$routes->get('/', 'Home::index');

// Mapping to a specific controller
$routes->add('journals', 'Blogs::index');

// Wildcard mapping
$routes->add('product/(:segment)', 'Catalog::productLookup');

// Back-reference
$routes->add('login/(.+)', 'Auth::login/$1');

/*
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Additional Routing
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 *
 * There will often be times that you need additional routing and you
 * need it to be able to override any defaults in this file. Environment
 * based routes is one such time. require() additional route files here
 * to make that happen.
 *
 * You will have access to the $routes object within that file without
 * needing to reload it.
 */
if (is_file(APPPATH . 'Config/' . ENVIRONMENT . '/Routes.php')) {
    require APPPATH . 'Config/' . ENVIRONMENT . '/Routes.php';
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Rate Limiting Filter in CodeIgniter 4
DESCRIPTION: This code creates a Throttle filter that limits requests to one per second per IP address. It uses the Throttler class to check and limit requests, returning a 429 status code if the limit is exceeded.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/libraries/throttler.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Filters;

use CodeIgniter\Filters\FilterInterface;
use CodeIgniter\HTTP\RequestInterface;
use CodeIgniter\HTTP\ResponseInterface;
use Config\Services;

class Throttle implements FilterInterface
{
    /**
     * This is a demo implementation of using the Throttler class
     * to implement rate limiting for your application.
     *
     * @param RequestInterface $request
     * @param array|null       $arguments
     *
     * @return mixed
     */
    public function before(RequestInterface $request, $arguments = null)
    {
        $throttler = Services::throttler();

        // Restrict an IP address to no more than 1 request
        // per second across the entire site.
        if ($throttler->check($request->getIPAddress(), 60, MINUTE) === false) {
            return Services::response()->setStatusCode(429);
        }
    }

    /**
     * We don't have anything to do here.
     *
     * @param RequestInterface  $request
     * @param ResponseInterface $response
     * @param array|null        $arguments
     *
     * @return mixed
     */
    public function after(RequestInterface $request, ResponseInterface $response, $arguments = null)
    {
        // ...
    }
}
```

TITLE: Logging Database Queries using Events in PHP/CodeIgniter4
DESCRIPTION: Example of implementing a database query logger using CodeIgniter's Events system. This code sets up an event listener for the 'DBQuery' event to log all database queries with their execution time and connection details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/database/events.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
<?php

Events::on('DBQuery', static function ($query) {
    static $filepath = WRITEPATH . 'DBQuery.log';

    $newLine = sprintf(
        '[%s] Query: "%s" in %.3f ms using %s connection',
        DateTime::createFromFormat('U.u', microtime(true))->format('Y-m-d H:i:s.u'),
        $query->getQuery(),
        $query->getDuration(5), // get duration in float with 5 decimal places
        $query->getConnectionName()
    );

    file_put_contents($filepath, $newLine . "\n", FILE_APPEND);
});
```

```
namespace App\Models;

class BlogModel extends Model

    {
```

TITLE: Database Query Examples in CodeIgniter 4.x
DESCRIPTION: Code sample showing the equivalent database operations in CodeIgniter 4.x, including connecting to the database, running queries, using the Query Builder, and retrieving results with the updated method names and syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_database.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Models;

use CodeIgniter\Model;

class BlogModel extends Model
{
    public function getBlogList()
    {
        $db = db_connect();

        // Simple Query
        $query = $db->query('SELECT * FROM blog');
        $result = $query->getResult();

        // Using Query Builder
        $builder = $db->table('blog');
        $query = $builder->get();
        $result = $query->getResultArray();

        // Using Query Builder with where
        $builder = $db->table('blog');
        $query = $builder->getWhere(['id' => 1]);
        $row = $query->getRow();

        // Query Builder methods
        $builder = $db->table('blog');
        $builder->select('title, content, date');
        $builder->where('status', 'active');
        $builder->orderBy('date', 'DESC');
        $builder->limit(10);
        $query = $builder->get();
        $result = $query->getResult();

        return $result;
    }
}
```

TITLE: File Upload Implementation in CodeIgniter 4.x
DESCRIPTION: Example of handling file uploads in CodeIgniter 4.x using the new uploaded files approach. This method simplifies validation with isValid() and provides direct methods for file operations like store().
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_file_upload.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Controllers;

use CodeIgniter\Files\File;

class Upload extends BaseController
{
    protected $helpers = ['form'];

    public function index()
    {
        return view('upload_form', ['errors' => []]);
    }

    public function upload()
    {
        $validationRule = [
            'userfile' => [
                'label' => 'Image File',
                'rules' => [
                    'uploaded[userfile]',
                    'is_image[userfile]',
                    'mime_in[userfile,image/jpg,image/jpeg,image/gif,image/png,image/webp]',
                    'max_size[userfile,100]',
                    'max_dims[userfile,1024,768]',
                ],
            ],
        ];
        if (! $this->validate($validationRule)) {
            $data = ['errors' => $this->validator->getErrors()];

            return view('upload_form', $data);
        }

        $img = $this->request->getFile('userfile');

        if (! $img->hasMoved()) {
            $filepath = WRITEPATH . 'uploads/' . $img->store();

            $data = ['uploaded_flleinfo' => new File($filepath)];

            return view('upload_success', $data);
        }

        $data = ['errors' => 'The file has already been moved.'];

        return view('upload_form', $data);
    }
}
```

```
<?php

namespace App\Models;

use CodeIgniter\Model;

class BlogModel extends Model
{
    protected $table = 'entries';
    protected $allowedFields = ['title', 'content', 'date'];

    public function getLastTenEntries()
    {
        return $this->orderBy('id', 'desc')
                    ->findAll(10);
    }

    public function insertEntry($title, $content)
    {
        $data = [
            'title'   => $title,
            'content' => $content,
            'date'    => time(),
        ];

        return $this->insert($data);
    }

    public function updateEntry($id, $title, $content)
    {
        $data = [
            'title'   => $title,
            'content' => $content,
        ];

        return $this->update($id, $data);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Pagination in CodeIgniter 3.x
DESCRIPTION: Example of pagination implementation in CodeIgniter 3.x showing controller configuration and database queries. The snippet demonstrates how to set up pagination configuration, load the pagination library, and retrieve data with pagination limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_pagination.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Controllers;

class Products extends CI_Controller
{
    public function index()
    {
        // load pagination library
        $this->load->library('pagination');
        
        // init params
        $config['total_rows'] = $this->db->count_all('products');
        $config['per_page'] = 20;
        $config['uri_segment'] = 3;
        $config['base_url'] = site_url('products/index');
        $this->pagination->initialize($config);
        
        $data['pagination'] = $this->pagination;
        
        // get current page records
        $data['products'] = $this->db
                           ->get('products', $config['per_page'], $this->uri->segment(3))
                           ->result();
        
        $this->load->view('products/index', $data);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Adding Content Security Policy Rules at Runtime
DESCRIPTION: Examples of adding various CSP directives at runtime through the response object. These methods allow specifying trusted content sources for different resource types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/outgoing/csp.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Sites we can load images from
$this->response->getCSP()->addImageSrc('cdn.example.com');

// Sites we can send AJAX requests to
$this->response->getCSP()->addConnectSrc('api.example.com');

// Allows certain styles, media, scripts, etc to load from specific sources
$this->response->getCSP()->addStyleSrc('cdn.example.com');
$this->response->getCSP()->addStyleSrc('css.example.com', true);     // report only for this
$this->response->getCSP()->addMediaSrc('cdn.example.com');
$this->response->getCSP()->addScriptSrc('js.example.com', false);    // explicitly block
$this->response->getCSP()->addFrameSrc('deframe.example.com');       // control iframes
$this->response->getCSP()->addWorkerSrc('worker.example.com');       // control worker scripts
$this->response->getCSP()->addFormAction('action.example.com');      // control form actions

// Specify your CSP policy clearly
$this->response->getCSP()->addDirective('default-src', 'none');      // nothing allowed by default
$this->response->getCSP()->addDirective('script-src', 'self');       // only local scripts allowed
```

TITLE: Testing CLI Input with PhpStreamWrapper in CodeIgniter 4
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use PhpStreamWrapper to simulate user input in CLI commands. The wrapper allows setting predefined input content to be returned when a command requests user input.

```
<?php

namespace CodeIgniter;

use CodeIgniter\Test\PhpStreamWrapper;

final class SomeTest extends CIUnitTestCase
{
    protected function setUp(): void
    {
        parent::setUp();

        // Register PhpStreamWrapper
        PhpStreamWrapper::register();
    }

    protected function tearDown(): void
    {
        // Restore the original php protocol wrapper
        PhpStreamWrapper::restore();

        parent::tearDown();
    }

    public function testWaitForAnyKey(): void
    {
        // Set the input data
        PhpStreamWrapper::setContent('abcdefg');

        // Call CLI::prompter() asking for user input
        $output = CLI::prompter('Give a name for the controller', 'Home');

        // Check that the output matches our input
        $this->assertSame('abcdefg', $output);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Image Manipulation in CodeIgniter 4.x
DESCRIPTION: Updated code for image manipulation in CodeIgniter 4.x. It uses the image service with method chaining for resizing and cropping operations, and requires explicit save method calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_images.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Controllers;

use CodeIgniter\Controller;

class MyClass extends Controller
{
    public function processImage()
    {
        $image = \Config\Services::image();

        // Resize the image with method chaining
        $image->withFile(WRITEPATH . 'uploads/images/sample_image.jpg')
              ->resize(500, 300, true, 'height')
              ->save(WRITEPATH . 'uploads/images/sample_image_resized.jpg');

        // Crop the image
        $image->withFile(WRITEPATH . 'uploads/images/sample_image.jpg')
              ->crop(100, 100, 100, 60, true)
              ->save(WRITEPATH . 'uploads/images/sample_image_cropped.jpg');
    }
}
```

TITLE: Image Manipulation in CodeIgniter 3.x
DESCRIPTION: Sample code demonstrating image manipulation in CodeIgniter 3.x. It uses the image_lib library with constructor preferences for resizing an image and creating a thumbnail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_images.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

class My_class extends CI_Controller
{
    public function process_image()
    {
        // Setting preferences
        $config['image_library'] = 'gd2';
        $config['source_image'] = 'uploads/images/sample_image.jpg';
        $config['create_thumb'] = TRUE;
        $config['maintain_ratio'] = TRUE;
        $config['width'] = 500;
        $config['height'] = 300;

        // Loading the image library
        $this->load->library('image_lib', $config);

        // Resize the image
        if (! $this->image_lib->resize())
        {
            echo $this->image_lib->display_errors();
        }

        // Clear existing preferences
        $this->image_lib->clear();

        // Setting preferences for image crop
        $config2['image_library'] = 'gd2';
        $config2['source_image'] = 'uploads/images/sample_image.jpg';
        $config2['x_axis'] = '100';
        $config2['y_axis'] = '60';
        $config2['maintain_ratio'] = FALSE;

        // Initialize the image library with new preferences
        $this->image_lib->initialize($config2);

        // crop the image
        if (! $this->image_lib->crop())
        {
            echo $this->image_lib->display_errors();
        }
    }
}
```

```
namespace App\Database\Migrations;

            'blog_id' => [
                'type'           => 'INT',
                'constraint'     => 5,
                'unsigned'       => true,
                'auto_increment' => true,

                'null' => true,

        $this->forge->addKey('blog_id', true);

    {

    }
}
```

```
namespace CodeIgniter;

use CodeIgniter\Test\Filters\StreamFilterTrait;

final class SomeTest extends CIUnitTestCase
{
    use StreamFilterTrait;

    public function testSomeOutput(): void
    {
        // Use STDOUT stream filter
        $this->streamFilter();

        // Generate some output
        CLI::write('first.');
        echo 'second';
        
        // Get the stream filter buffer
        $output = $this->getStreamFilterBuffer();
        
        // Reset the stream filter buffer
        $this->resetStreamFilterBuffer();
        
        // Test the output
        $this->assertStringContainsString('first', $output);
        $this->assertStringContainsString('second', $output);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Demonstrating Validation Rule Changes in CodeIgniter 4.4.4
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates the changes in validation behavior for dot array syntax in CodeIgniter 4.4.4. It shows how the '*' wildcard now correctly validates data only at the specified dimension level, fixing a previous bug where it validated at any level.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_444.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
<?php

$data = [
    'contacts' => [
        [
            'name' => 'John Doe',
            'phone' => '09012345678',
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
        ],
        [
            'name' => 'Jane Doe',
            'phone' => '09023456789',
            'email' => 'jane@example.com',
        ],
    ],
];

$rules = [
    // This rule key now only validates 'contacts.*.name'
    'contacts.*.name' => 'required|string',

    // If you need to validate deeper levels, you must specify them explicitly
    'contacts.*.*.name' => 'required|string',
    'contacts.*.*.*.name' => 'required|string',
];

// Run validation
$validation = \Config\Services::validation();
$validation->setRules($rules);
$isValid = $validation->run($data);
```

```
namespace CodeIgniter;

    {

        // Add filter to the output stream
```

DESCRIPTION: A sample CodeIgniter 3.x model showing the traditional CI_Model extension structure. This example demonstrates the old model pattern without namespaces.

```
<?php

class Blog_model extends CI_Model
{
    public function get_last_ten_entries()
    {
        $query = $this->db->get('entries', 10);
        return $query->result();
    }

    public function insert_entry($title, $content)
    {
        $this->db->set('title', $title);
        $this->db->set('content', $content);
        $this->db->set('date', time());

        return $this->db->insert('entries');
    }

    public function update_entry($id, $title, $content)
    {
        $this->db->set('title', $title);
        $this->db->set('content', $content);

        $this->db->where('id', $id);

        return $this->db->update('entries');
    }
}
```

TITLE: Migration Example in CodeIgniter 3.x
DESCRIPTION: Sample migration file from CodeIgniter 3.x that demonstrates the old format with sequential naming and CI_Migration extension. This shows the structure that needs to be updated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_migrations.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

defined('BASEPATH') OR exit('No direct script access allowed');

class Migration_Create_blog extends CI_Migration {

    public function up()
    {
        $this->dbforge->add_field([
            'blog_id' => [
                'type'           => 'INT',
                'constraint'     => 5,
                'unsigned'       => true,
                'auto_increment' => true,
            ],
            'blog_title' => [
                'type'       => 'VARCHAR',
                'constraint' => '100',
            ],
            'blog_description' => [
                'type' => 'TEXT',
                'null' => true,
            ],
        ]);
        $this->dbforge->add_key('blog_id', true);
        $this->dbforge->create_table('blog');
    }

    public function down()
    {
        $this->dbforge->drop_table('blog');
    }
}
```

TITLE: Modifying CodeIgniter 4 Spark Command Line Tool
DESCRIPTION: This code modifies the 'spark' command line tool to locate the Paths configuration file when the application directory has been renamed or relocated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/general/managing_apps.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

/**
 * This file is part of CodeIgniter 4 framework.
 *
 * (c) CodeIgniter Foundation <admin@codeigniter.com>
 *
 * For the full copyright and license information, please view
 * the LICENSE file that was distributed with this source code.
 */

/*
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * CodeIgniter command-line tools
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * The main entry point into the CLI system and allows you to run
 * commands and perform maintenance on your application.
 *
 * Because CodeIgniter can be set up to use multiple applications with
 * shared frameworks, we need to be especially careful about loading
 * the correct framework for the application. This line should point
 * to the paths.php file that defines this application's paths.
 */
require realpath(__DIR__ . '/app/Config/Paths.php') ?: __DIR__ . '/app/Config/Paths.php';
// ^^^ Change this if you move your application folder

/*
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Load Bootstrap
 * --------------------------------------------------------------------
 *
 * This process sets up the path constants, loads and registers
 * our autoloader, along with Composer's, loads our constants
 * and fires up an environment-specific bootstrapping.
 */
require_once FCPATH . '../system/bootstrap.php';

// Grab our Console
$app = new CodeIgniter\CLI\Console();

// We want errors to be shown when using it from the CLI.
$app->showErrors();

// Show basic information before we do anything else.
$app->showHeader();

// fire off the command in the main framework.
$exit = $app->run();

exit($exit);

```

TITLE: Database Query Examples in CodeIgniter 3.x
DESCRIPTION: Code sample demonstrating how database connections and queries were implemented in CodeIgniter 3.x, including loading the database, running queries, using Query Builder methods, and retrieving results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_database.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:

```
<?php

class Blog_model extends CI_Model
{
    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->load->database();
    }

    public function get_blog_list()
    {
        // Simple Query
        $query = $this->db->query('SELECT * FROM blog');
        $result = $query->result();

        // Using Query Builder
        $query = $this->db->get('blog');
        $result = $query->result_array();

        // Using Query Builder with where
        $query = $this->db->get_where('blog', ['id' => 1]);
        $row = $query->row();

        // Query Builder methods
        $this->db->select('title, content, date');
        $this->db->where('status', 'active');
        $this->db->order_by('date', 'DESC');
        $this->db->limit(10);
        $query = $this->db->get('blog');
        $result = $query->result();

        return $result;
    }
}
```

TITLE: Modifying CodeIgniter 4 Front Controller
DESCRIPTION: This code modifies the front controller (public/index.php) to locate the Paths configuration file when the application directory has been renamed or relocated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/general/managing_apps.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

use CodeIgniter\Config\DotEnv;
use CodeIgniter\Config\Services;

// Check PHP version.
$minPhpVersion = '7.4'; // If you update this, don't forget to update `spark`.
if (version_compare(PHP_VERSION, $minPhpVersion, '<')) {
    $message = sprintf(
        'Your PHP version must be %s or higher to run CodeIgniter. Current version: %s',
        $minPhpVersion,
        PHP_VERSION
    );

    exit($message);
}

// Path to the front controller (this file)
define('FCPATH', __DIR__ . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR);

// Ensure the current directory is pointing to the front controller's directory
if (getcwd() . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR !== FCPATH) {
    chdir(FCPATH);
}

/*
 *---------------------------------------------------------------
 * BOOTSTRAP THE APPLICATION
 *---------------------------------------------------------------
 * This process sets up the path constants, loads and registers
 * our autoloader, along with Composer's, loads our constants
 * and fires up an environment-specific bootstrapping.
 */

// Load our paths config file
// This is the line that might need to be changed, depending on your folder structure.
require FCPATH . '../app/Config/Paths.php';
// ^^^ Change this line if you move your application folder

$app = require rtrim($paths->systemDirectory, '/ ') . '/bootstrap.php';

/*
 *---------------------------------------------------------------
 * LAUNCH THE APPLICATION
 *---------------------------------------------------------------
 * Now that everything is set up, it's time to actually fire
 * up the engines and make this app do its thang.
 */
$app->run();

```

TITLE: File Upload Implementation in CodeIgniter 3.x
DESCRIPTION: Example of handling file uploads in CodeIgniter 3.x using the File Uploading Class. This approach requires configuration of upload options and manual validation of upload status.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/installation/upgrade_file_upload.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

class Upload extends CI_Controller
{
    public function __construct()
    {
        parent::__construct();
        $this->load->helper(array('form', 'url'));
    }

    public function index()
    {
        $this->load->view('upload_form', array('error' => ' '));
    }

    public function do_upload()
    {
        $config['upload_path']      = './uploads/';
        $config['allowed_types']    = 'gif|jpg|png';
        $config['max_size']         = 100;
        $config['max_width']        = 1024;
        $config['max_height']       = 768;

        $this->load->library('upload', $config);

        if (! $this->upload->do_upload('userfile')) {
            $error = array('error' => $this->upload->display_errors());

            $this->load->view('upload_form', $error);
        } else {
            $data = array('upload_data' => $this->upload->data());

            $this->load->view('upload_success', $data);
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Handling News Item Creation in CodeIgniter 4 Controller
DESCRIPTION: This method validates form data, saves the news item to the database, and returns a success view upon successful creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/tutorial/create_news_items.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
public function create()
{
    helper('form');

    $data = $this->request->getPost(['title', 'body']);

    // Checks whether the submitted data passed the validation rules.
    if (! $this->validateData($data, [
        'title' => 'required|max_length[255]|min_length[3]',
        'body'  => 'required|max_length[5000]|min_length[10]',
    ])) {
        // The validation fails, so returns the form.
        return $this->new();
    }

    // Gets the validated data.
    $post = $this->validator->getValidated();

    $model = model(NewsModel::class);

    $model->save([
        'title' => $post['title'],
        'slug'  => url_title($post['title'], '-', true),
        'body'  => $post['body'],
    ]);

    return view('templates/header', ['title' => 'Create a news item'])
        . view('news/success')
        . view('templates/footer');
}
```

DESCRIPTION: Command to add the original CodeIgniter repository as a remote called 'upstream', enabling synchronization between your fork and the main project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/contributing/workflow.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
> git remote add upstream UPSTREAM_URL
```

TITLE: Setting Manual Index Names in CodeIgniter 4 Database Forge
DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of manually setting index names using the updated Forge methods in CodeIgniter 4.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/changelogs/v4.3.0.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$forge->addKey('title', false, false, 'my_title_index');
$forge->addPrimaryKey('id', 'my_primary_key');
$forge->addUniqueKey(['email', 'username'], 'my_unique_key');
```

TITLE: Creating a new minor version branch
DESCRIPTION: Git commands to create a new minor version branch from the develop branch for the next next minor version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/admin/RELEASE.md#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
git fetch upstream
git switch develop
git switch -c 4.z
git push upstream HEAD
```

TITLE: Writing Data to File in CodeIgniter 4
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates writing data to a file using write_file()
SOURCE: https://github.com/codeigniter4/CodeIgniter4/blob/develop/user_guide_src/source/helpers/filesystem_helper.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$data = 'Some file data';
if (write_file('path/to/file.txt', $data)) {
    echo 'File written!';
} else {
    echo 'Unable to write the file';
}
```
